abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sichuan Urban
            Development Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: there is need to be candid about the
            capacity of the client and ability to implement projects
            with due regard to the full range of Bank requirements. The
            design of a clear and measurable results framework is
            critical. Increased attention should be given to safeguard
            issues and the risks posed on the timely completion of
            infrastructure investments. The project also highlighted the
            importance of considering a strategic environmental
            assessment (SEA) for these types of projects. The challenges
            associated with operations and maintenance (O and M) were
            anticipated during project design and included in a
            covenant; however the project should have provided greater
            support to cities on capital investment planning and asset
            management. The development of economic development zone
            (EDZ) has to be accompanied by significant technical
            assistance and capacity building to understand the local
            competitiveness and design effective policies and incentives
            to attract private investments. Project designs should
            consider the risk of changes to city and regional master
            plans. Attention to disaster risk management and climate
            risks must be given due regarded in infrastructure projects.
